content.raw:
During last summer some users of the Gazebo-based iCub simulator reported some strange behaviors in the simulated IMU orientation measurement.  

In particular they reported some strange delays in the measured orientation. that were partially resolved by this commit:  https://bitbucket.org/traversaro/gazebo-fork/commits/00b21643a0d8fca466aa18b53e954f3ddc37409b?at=imuOrientationWithNoDelay in a forked version of Gazebo. Note that this delay issue is not affecting the large part of Gazebo users, because the ROS IMU plugin is not using the Gazebo IMU sensor.

Porting that fix upstream was on my todo list since then, but I had some problem in understanding the design of the IMU Sensor. In particular it seems that for some reason the linear/angular velocity of the link is read from a topic (with the delay/timing uncertainty that the topic communication implies, especially under heavy load), while the pose is read directly from the methods of the Link class, as the other "simple" sensors such as `force_torque` and `accelerometer` do. There is some reason for this IMU specificity?
